meanings.definition: A large, powerful animal with shaggy fur and curved horns, native to Africa and Asia.
meanings.sent1: The buffaloes grazed peacefully in the meadow.
meanings.sent2: I saw a herd of buffaloes at the zoo.
meanings.sent3: The buffaloes seemed to be having a serious discussion about the best grazing spots.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a herd of buffaloes charging forward.
meanings.sent5: The image of the buffaloes running across the savanna stayed with me.

meanings.definition: A dark, heavy leather made from the skin of a buffalo.
meanings.sent1: She admired the quality of the buffaloes used in the leather jacket.
meanings.sent2: The store displayed a variety of products made from buffaloes.
meanings.sent3: The buffaloes leather bag added a touch of elegance to her outfit.
meanings.sent4: The buffaloes leather shoes were durable and stylish.
meanings.sent5: The scent of buffaloes leather filled the room, reminding her of the wild.

meanings.sent1: The complex instructions seemed to buffaloes the students.
meanings.sent2: He tried to buffaloes his opponent with a fierce stare.
meanings.sent3: The magician's tricks managed to buffaloes the audience.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected question buffaloes him during the interview.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise from the fireworks buffaloes the birds in the trees.
